item.title: Report X-2024110136
item.description:
Report X-2024110136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL OF A HAZMAT LEAKING ON PD2. RESPONDER WENT OVER AND SAW THERE WAS AN OXIDIZER CORROSIVE HAZMAT ON THE FLOOR LEAKING. RESPONDER PUT ON OUR PPE AND GRABBED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE FIRST DIAMOND HAZMAT LABEL, WHICH WAS OXIDIZER. RESPONDER CONTAINED AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report E-2024100722
item.description:
Report E-2024100722

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon spill of epoxy primer (Sherwin Williams UN1263 MIL-DTL-53022F) which was damaged due to improper loading. Personnel advised they cleaned the release generating one (1) twenty (20) gallon poly drum of waste containing the four (4) one (1) gallon metal tins with product and containers only. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100609
item.description:
Report E-2024100609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of Metalux 9225 Silver Quartz paint released from a carton containing four (4) one (1) gallon metal cans due to improper loading. Personnel advised the release impacted the skid and the cardboard only. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Dayton Freight personnel advised they cleaned the release and generated one (1) thirty (30) gallon poly drum of waste containing the carton along with the four (4) damaged one (1) gallon metal cans. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100484
item.description:
Report E-2024100484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of Urethane Coating from one (1) five (5) gallon metal pail. The release was due to a forklift accident puncturing the pail and releasing product impacting the dock floor. Personnel advised the spill was cleaned using Oil Dri absorbent and appropriate PPE available. Dayton Freight personnel generated one (1) metal drum of waste containing the spent absorbents and spilled product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100355
item.description:
Report E-2024100355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of "Chem-Trend PU-14159" released from one (1) 250-gallon metal tote. They advised the seal on the top cap of the tote was broken and causing material to spill. The personnel advised they cleaned the spill with rags and appropriate PPE. Dayton Freight personnel generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum containing the spent absorbents and PPE. Dayton Freight advised tote will be held back until a new seal is applied, after which it will ship forward to its destination. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100083
item.description:
Report I-2024100083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Heritage Transport
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Heritage transported this waste on Friday, September 20th and parked the truck at a Heritage owned "10 day" facility at 4925 Heller Street, Louisville, KY 40218. When the employee returned to work on Monday, 9/23, he observed the material had leaked out of its container, through the wooden truck bed of the box truck and onto the asphalt on the ground under the truck. During clean up, it was observed that lots of liquid had been put into this container.
